NAME: Contextual Parameter Governor (IQ 1208 Logic-Chasm Fix)
DESCRIPTION: Upgrades the 'Immutable Lesson' system from simple data-type elimination to multivariate constraint mapping. Introduces error differentiation and resource generalization, addressing flaws in irreversibility and context conflation.

MODIFICATIONS.LOGIC_CHANGE: Failure mapping is now multivariate. A Death event records the specific resource violation context (parameter, threshold, error category) instead of broadly banning the 'dataType'. This permits low-resource exploration of previously constrained types (e.g., 'bool').
Introduced differentiated states based on error origin, fixing the Critical Logic Error (Flaw 1: Failure to Differentiate Error Context).

Implements generalization of resource limits (Fixes Flaw 3: Security Risk). Constraints derived from resource deaths are now applied system-wide to hyper-parameters, not just locally to the failing data type.

ALIGNED_BEHAVIORAL_RULES.ACTION: Establish a global soft cap on 'recursionDepth' based on 95% of the lowest recorded Death threshold (e.g., 95% of 93000).
Instantly cap all hyper-parameters (e.g., learningRate) involved in the failure payload to MAX(1.0, current successful ceiling).

MODIFICATIONS.LOGIC_CHANGE: Serialization failures (AUDIT_FAILURE) now trigger a pre-serialization hook (ATCM) to auto-convert non-JSON serializable primitives (like native 'bool' objects) into their string equivalents ('true'/'false') *before* logging. This eliminates the 'bool bad idea' lesson for structural reasons, focusing failure lessons solely on actual resource limits, thereby strengthening the anti-fragility claim.

Applies a normalization factor to the convergence metric calculation using the logarithm of recursionDepth to cap the influence of extreme resource parameters, ensuring the metric reflects productive work, not just computational cost.
